clinical_study.brief_title: Prognostic Value of Stem Cell Related Markers
clinical_study.official_title: Prognostic Value of Stem Cell Related Markers CD24, CD44, CD326 and EPCR, for Predicting Breast Cancer Recurrence in Tumor Stages 0-II

lead_sponsor.agency: The Baruch Padeh Medical Center, Poriya

clinical_study.source: The Baruch Padeh Medical Center, Poriya

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of the investigators study is to identify a prognostic marker that will evaluate the probability of recurrence in patients with stage 0-II breast cancer following surgery to remove the tumor.

study_pop.textblock: 100 tumor specimens from women with grade 0-11 ductal breast cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ductal Carcinoma in Situ
- DCIS + Microinvasion stages 1 or 11 without positive lymph nodes
Exclusion Criteria:
- tumor specimen with higher than grade II
- BRACA 1 or BRACA 2 mutation
- Neoadjuvant chemotherapy
